channel.title: Labs on MIT OpenCourseWare
channel.description: Recent content in Labs on MIT OpenCourseWare

item.title: eesafety.pdf
item.description: This resource discusses about the topics: never work alone, voltage rules and prevent accidents.

item.title: lab_handout.pdf
item.description: This handout is intended to provide a brief technical overview of the lab instruments like the oscilloscope, multimeter, function generator, and the protoboard.

item.title: lab0.pdf
item.description: This resource focus on lab and its use: good lab practice, and lab safcty

item.title: lab1.pdf
item.description: This resource explores the characterization of a network by its Thevenin and Norton equivalents.

item.title: lab2.pdf
item.description: This lab examines the behavior of an inverting MOSFET amplifier.

item.title: lab3.pdf
item.description: The purpose of this lab is to give experience with second-order networks, and to illustrate that real network elements do not always behave in an ideal manner.

item.title: lab4.pdf
item.description: In this lab, one will construct, test and demonstrate the audio playback system.

item.title: labpractices.pdf
item.description: This handout discusses aspects of the experimental lab work.

item.title: Labs
item.description: Lab Practice and Safety (PDF) Electrical Safety (PDF) Lab Equipment Handout (PDF) LABS TOPICS SUPPORTINGÂ FILES 0 Lab familiarization (PDF) 1 Thevenin/Norton equivalents and logic gates (PDF - 1.3 MB) Fairchild Semiconductor 2N7000 datasheet 2 MOSFET inverting amplifiers and first-order circuits (PDF) 3 Second-order networks (PDF) Prelab 3-2 (M) Prelab 3-5 (M) 4 Audio playback system (PDF)

item.title: prelab_3_2.m
item.description: This file is a supporting file for the third lab - Second-order networks.

item.title: prelab_3_5.m
item.description: This resource is a supporting file for 3rd lab second-order networks.
